tweet: La comunidad internacional va interpretar lo que sucede con la MACCIH como un claro indicador del compromiso que tiene el presidente Hernández con respecto al combate de la corrupción.
Pido de nuevo que Presidente @JuanOrlandoH extienda el mandato de @OEA_MACCIH. Él lo puede hacer unilateralmente bajo el acuerdo del gobierno hondureño con la @OAS_official.

I urge President @JuanOrlandoH to extend the mandate of @OEA_MACCIH. He can do so unilaterally under the agreement with @OAS. The international community will rightly interpret what happens to MACCIH as an indicator of President Hernandez’s commitment to combatting corruption.
Hay que aumentar aún más la presión contra Maduro; sólo unas elecciones libres y justas pueden detener la destrucción que él ha causado.
El ataque dirigido por los matones de Maduro contra los miembros de la Asamblea Nacional reforzó que las bandas criminales están plenamente integradas en el sistema de represión de Maduro.

Ayer, el mundo volvió a presenciar la depravación de Nicolás Maduro. El mensaje del dictador queda claro: él va seguir utilizando la violencia hasta que haya eliminado la última institución democrática que existe en Venezuela.

The targeted attack by Maduro’s thugs against National Assembly members reinforced how criminal gangs are integrated into Maduro’s system of repression. I will continue to work to increase pressure on Maduro; only free and fair elections can halt the destruction he has caused.

Yesterday, the world again witnessed the depravity of Nicolás Maduro. The dictator’s message is clear: he will continue to use violence until he has successfully eliminated Venezuela’s last democratic institution.

Legislating is often a long and frustrating process but my Democratic colleagues and I will continue working on behalf of the American people. It is no accident that this year's NDAA is progressive, and I'll keep working in Congress to advance our priorities through legislation.

The resolution is called H.Con.Res.83, and it directs the President to terminate the use of America’s Armed Forces engaged in hostilities in or against Iran. Just as I supported the NDAA provision, I voted for this important resolution.

For example, although the House-passed NDAA included a provision I voted for prohibiting unauthorized war with Iran, the final version of the bill did not. But yesterday, the House voted on a similar War Powers resolution regarding the issue.

Legislating is a process of negotiation and compromise, so not every position we want will be included in a final bill. But our system is designed to allow legislative efforts to evolve – just because a policy isn’t in one bill doesn’t mean its doomed.

Legislating is a process of negotiation and compromise, so not every position we want will be included in a final bill. But our system is designed to allow legislative efforts to evolve – just because a policy isn’t in one bill doesn’t mean its doomed.

And this NDAA authorizes millions of dollars for military climate readiness and resiliency projects, directs DOD to plan for current climate-change vulnerabilities on our mil bases, and authorizes funding for military clean-energy research projects.

The bill also bans the use of PFAS forever-chemicals in firefighting agents used on military bases and in the packaging used for servicemembers’ field meals, known as MREs. This is an important step forward in limiting the exposure of PFAS chems in our food and water supplies.

And it repeals the “Widow’s Tax,” which is what happens when a fallen servicemember’s surviving spouse – who is entitled to two gov. annuity payments – has one payment reduced dollar-for-dollar by the other. Surviving spouses depend on these payments. I’m proud to vote to fix it.
For example – and for the first time ever – this year’s NDAA implements 12 weeks of paid parental leave for all federal employees. This leave policy includes leave for birth, adoption, or fostering.
But this year’s NDAA is among the most progressive ever enacted thanks to House Democrats prioritizing medical, family leave, environmental, and health provisions.

The NDAA is a massive bill (this year’s was over 1,000 pages long) that includes authorization and funding-level agreements for nearly every program run by the Department of Defense (DOD) – this includes servicemember pay, funding for arms upgrades, and so on.

Each year, Congress gets together to debate which national defense programs to reauthorize and which ones to reel in. This is done through a legislative vehicle known as the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA).
This bill is an important step towards preventing contamination of our food and water sources by a possibly-harmful chemical. It passed the House by a vote of 247 to 159 and now goes to the Senate.

Today, I voted for H.R. 535, the PFAS Action Act, to have the Environmental Protection Agency list PFAS chemicals as hazardous substances in order to strengthen scientific scrutiny of their possible impacts on our health.

The American people do not want another war and this resolution will ensure that no lives of American servicemembers are unnecessarily put at risk. Read my full statement: https://sires.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/house-passes-war-powers-resolution …

January is Cervical Health Awareness Month. Cervical cancer is caused by HPV, which affects about 9 million Americans. Thankfully, cervical cancer is often preventable through vaccines and regular screenings. La necesidad de elecciones libres y justas en Venezuela nunca ha sido más urgente. #VenezuelaLibre Lea mi declaración aquí: https://bit.ly/36uIpar

@jguaido sigue siendo el jefe legítimo de @AsambleaVE y el presidente interino de Venezuela. Voy a seguir trabajando con mis colegas para apoya los esfuerzos del pueblo venezolano de restaurar la democracia.

Su decisión de utilizar las fuerzas de seguridad para impedir que legisladores elegidos cumplan con sus obligaciones, luego de un esfuerzo de meses para sobornar a los legisladores para que votaran en contra de @jguaido, es simplemente lo que debemos anticipar de parte de Maduro.
Los eventos de ayer en Venezuela revelaron lo que ya sabíamos: @NicolasMaduro es un dictador, decidido mantenerse en el poder sin importar el sufrimiento que causa a su propio pueblo.
The need for free and fair elections in Venezuela has never been more urgent. #VenezuelaLibre

@jguaido remains the legitimate head of the @AsambleaVE and the Interim President of Venezuela under the country’s constitution. I will continue to work with his government and my colleagues to support the Venezuelan people’s aspiration to restore democracy to their country.

His decision to use security forces to block duly elected legislators from carrying out their duties—following a months-long effort to bribe legislators to vote against @jguaido—is simply par for the course. See my full statement: https://bit.ly/2tE4jtd
Yesterday’s events in Venezuela revealed what we already knew: @NicolasMaduro is a dictator, determined to retain power no matter the suffering it causes for his people.
